replies.body:
I was playing an ARAM the other day, and a player on my team had lots of gold (you can only shop when you die in ARAM, no recall, for those who don't know).
They were like "should I just kill myself?". I had to respond with "answering that would get me banned".
It's a fucking stupid system.

Yeah because context doesn't matter, because all bans that are based on the no-no words, are done by a bot that can't detect context.

It's the same thing that youtube suffers from, with content ID, except arguably worse.

yeah context is so important but I guess the message riot are sending is that chat has to be vanilla and banter must be g rated.
You said "Kys" even though it in context wasn't a bad thing (refering to another player saying it), it's registered on Rito's end as a no-no word that will be flagged for instant bannings.
lazy fucks rito lmfao. im done bruh fuck that shit the fuck. was tryna be reformed that game but since riot fucked it up. ggez.
Just message Riot to check context. That's just an auto-flagged word.

From the look of it, I can't see any reason why this would warrant a suspension. At a guess, this case was reviewed by the automated system, which identified the term "kys" and didn't properly understand the context. I'd recommend submitting a ticket via [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us), who will forward it to the Player Behaviour team for a manual review. Ideally that will end with them realising the system made a mistake and revoking the suspension, though keep in mind that appeals are the "final decision" on punishments.
